Line 17: Line 17:      
For example, in applied ethics, three issues that revolve around interpretations of the moral ban on murder — [[capital punishment]], [[abortion]] and wars of [[invasion]] — are under contentious discussion in [[United States]] society and politics. In normative ethics, a common question is how one would justify a lie given for the sake of protecting someone from harm. A common meta-ethical question is of what is meant by the terms right or wrong. [[Moral realism]] would hold that the individual is attempting to elucidate some objective moral fact, whereas the various branches of [[moral non-realism]] would hold that morality is derived from either the norms of the prevalent society ([[cultural relativism]]), the edicts of a God ([[Divine Command Theory]]), is merely an expression of the speakers sentiments ([[emotivism]]), is an implied imperative ([[prescriptivism (philosophy)|prescriptivism]]) or is literally nonsense ([[Error theory]]).
 
For example, in applied ethics, three issues that revolve around interpretations of the moral ban on murder — [[capital punishment]], [[abortion]] and wars of [[invasion]] — are under contentious discussion in [[United States]] society and politics. In normative ethics, a common question is how one would justify a lie given for the sake of protecting someone from harm. A common meta-ethical question is of what is meant by the terms right or wrong. [[Moral realism]] would hold that the individual is attempting to elucidate some objective moral fact, whereas the various branches of [[moral non-realism]] would hold that morality is derived from either the norms of the prevalent society ([[cultural relativism]]), the edicts of a God ([[Divine Command Theory]]), is merely an expression of the speakers sentiments ([[emotivism]]), is an implied imperative ([[prescriptivism (philosophy)|prescriptivism]]) or is literally nonsense ([[Error theory]]).

To assume that any action or reaction is "right" or "wrong" is preposterous. Based upon the fact that free will is a control device created by those who possess power over others. To wrongfully assume that freedom exists, we would, by necessity, be held responsible for the entirity of all reality and the events that happen therein, as well as all that is nonexistent. Not one person had any choice as to exist or not, else they not be at all.--[[User:Prodvocalist|Prodvocalist]] 07:04, 16 April 2007 (UTC)
